This website is an introduction to OPA - the Open Post Academic Mentorship Program which is incubated through the [Mozilla Open Leaders program](https://foundation.mozilla.org/en/opportunity/mozilla-open-leaders/open-leaders-x/participants/).  

<center>The first cohort of the program is launching in January 2020.</center> 

<center>**Applications have closed.**</center>   

<br> 
Make sure you're on the [mailing list](https://mailchi.mp/2932ae7328f2/opa) to receive updates about the program!   

### Purpose 
To empower people with a PhD to share their knowledge and skills more openly. 

### Objectives 
- To expand the network of participants to more people outside of academia 
- For participants to understand their skill set and how to apply those abilities to projects outside of academia.
- To create a project that shares those skills openly. 


### Are you interested? 
If you are interested in supporting the 2020 cohort by sharing your expertise with them, applications are still open for joining our expert pool. These are folks who offer to do informational interviews with OPA participants.  

[Expert Pool](https://forms.gle/2xCpSvxpha3poMJFA)

If you want to be updated about the program, please [sign up to receive updates](https://mailchi.mp/2932ae7328f2/opa). 

Want more information? Some slides we used for the webinar to talk about the pogram are [here.](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/16uovImiIqoZQmWzfjmc2Npcef5XZ_gd-6Oec65_uZpc/edit?usp=sharing)
